summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Capital One Bank, demanding extensive financial records for specific individuals from January 1, 2015 onward. The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal conspiracy, fraud, and money laundering statutes.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signed the subpoena and the accompanying letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office. The name is not fully specified in the text.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Capital One Bank is commanded to appear before a grand jury in the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena for financial records is issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Capital One Bank NA, 15000 Capital One Drive, Richmond, VA 23238-1119
U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY, 86 Chambers Street, 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks all financial records from Capital One Bank for specific, unnamed individuals (whose details are redacted) from January 1, 2015, to the present.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), mail fraud (18 U.S.C. ยง 1341), wire fraud (18 U.S.C. ยง 1343), and money laundering (18 U.S.C. ยง 1956).
The document includes a strict non-disclosure warning, stating that revealing the subpoena's existence or contents could result in civil and criminal penalties, including up to five years in prison.

The requested records are extremely comprehensive, covering account documents, statements, wire transfers, credit card records, safety deposit boxes, online banking IP history, and even surveillance tapes.
The subpoena was received by Capital One's legal department in Richmond, VA, on September 3, 2019.
